newsitem.title: philippines: Manila shares tumble 1.59 pct at close on Dow.
newsitem.headline: Manila shares tumble 1.59 pct at close on Dow.

text.p: Manila shares settled sharply lower at close of trade on Tuesday as investors were unnerved by the Dow Jones' sharp overnight drop, traders said.
"Selling was noticed across-the-board. I think people are just scared of what happened and what's going to happen in Wall Street," said Poch Zamora, dealer at Peregrine Securities.
The main index dropped 51.19 points, or 1.59 percent, to 3,171.79 points.
"Everything is down because of the Dow's slump and this is spilling over into Asian markets including the Philippines," said Lawrence de Leon, analyst at Dharmala Securities Phils.
The Dow Jones shed 157.11 points on Monday, or 2.33 percent, to 6,583.48 points.
In the local arena, all of the sub-indices fell at the close with the exception of the mining sector which recovered from its heavy losses on Monday.
Value turnover was modest at 2.9 billion pesos equivalent to 9.875 billion shares. Joey Roxas, president at Eagle Equities, said the market will continue looking at the Dow for direction.
